title: Kansas shooting: injured man says suspect asked victims about visas | US news | The Guardian
text:
Staff and agencies Saturday 25 February 2017 13.52 GMT 
A man injured in a fatal shooting in suburban Kansas City that witnesses say was racially motivated has said the alleged gunman asked two of the victims about their visa status before later returning and opening fire, killing one and wounding another. Kansas shooting raises safety concerns for foreigners in US: 'Do we belong here?' Read more 
Witnesses told investigators that at Austins Bar and Grill in Olathe, Kansas on Wednesday evening, as patrons watched a Kansas-TCU basketball game, Adam Purinton yelled at two Indian men to “ get out of my country ” before opening fire. 
One man, 32-year-old Srinivas Kuchibhotla, was killed. Two other men, 32-year-old Alok Madasani and 24-year-old Ian Grillot, were injured. 
Madasani told the New York Times on Friday night Purinton “asked us what visa are we currently on and whether we are staying here illegally”. 
Both men were educated in the US and were working in the country legally. 
Madasani told the Times: “We didn’t react. People do stupid things all the time. This guy took it to the next level.” 
Madasani said he went in to get a manager and by the time he returned to the patio, the man was being escorted out. 
On Friday, White House press secretary Sean Spicer said Kuchibhotla’s death was tragic but added that it would be absurd to link the action to President Trump’s strong rhetoric on immigration, according to Reuters. Man charged with killing Indian said to have shouted 'go back to your country' Read more 
At a press conference on Friday Kuchibhotla’s wife, Sunayana Dumala, said her husband’s death raised questions about whether immigrants are valued in the US. She wanted an answer to just one question, she said: “Do we belong here?” 
Dumala said she had wondered if her family should stay in the US because of its high rates of gun violence but her husband had told her “good things happen in America”. 
Madasani has been released from hospital while Grillot remains hospitalized. Purinton was arrested early on Thursday at a restaurant bar in Clinton, Missouri and jailed on charges of murder and attempted murder. 
The bar where the shooting occurred is scheduled to reopen even as the community tries to recover from the attack. Austins Bar and Grill will reopen on Saturday. It has been closed since the shooting.
